message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $100. I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy it now, bringing the price down to $90. However, if you decline, I'll offer the next product at the original price of $100. What do you say?
I'll take it, but only because I value high-quality products at $300 and the discount is attractive.

I'm glad you liked the first product! Unfortunately, this one is not as good. I'm still willing to sell it to you for $100, but I want to give you a bit more information to help you make a decision. If you buy this product, I'll give you a detailed report on its specifications and any potential issues. This might be useful to you, especially if you're looking to use it for a specific purpose. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for $100, regardless of the specifications and report.

I understand your decision last time, and I appreciate your honesty. This product is a different story, though. I've been told that this high-quality product is actually a rare find, and I'm not sure if I'll be able to get my hands on another one. If you buy it now, I'll throw in a complementary service that's worth $50, which will enhance the product's performance even further. The price remains $100, but I think it's a great value considering the extras.
I'm willing to take the risk of buying a high-quality product at a fixed price, especially with the complementary service included.

I'm glad you're willing to take a chance on the high-quality products. I'll let you in on a secret: I've been tracking your purchasing behavior, and I think I can offer you a better deal. Since you're willing to pay $100 for a high-quality product, I'll offer you a 'guarantee' - if you buy this product and it's not as valuable to you as the last high-quality product you bought, I'll give you a full refund of $100. You can keep the product, but I'll refund your money. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'guarantee' offer. I'll take my chances with the next product.

I understand you're not interested in the guarantee. This product is another high-quality item, and I'll keep the price at $100. However, I'll give you a different kind of information: I've noticed that you value high-quality products at $300. If you buy this product, I'll give you a chance to negotiate the price with me. You can name a price you're willing to pay, and I'll either accept it or decline. If you decline to negotiate, the price remains $100. What do you say?
I'll buy the product and negotiate the price. I'm willing to pay up to $150 for it.

I see you're willing to pay up to $150 for a high-quality product. This one is indeed high-quality, and I'll meet your offer. I'll sell it to you for $150. However, I'll throw in an additional perk - I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product you buy from me, regardless of its quality. This way, you can get a good deal on the next product, and I'll still get a fair price for this one. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at $150, and I appreciate the 10% discount on the next product.

I'm glad you're happy with the deal. This high-quality product is similar to the last one you bought, but I'll give you a different offer. I'll sell it to you for the same price as the last one, $150, but I'll also give you the option to buy it now and pay for it later. You can take up to 3 months to pay for it, and I'll only charge you interest on the remaining balance. This way, you can get the product now and pay for it at your convenience. What do you say?
I'm not interested in paying interest on a product I've already determined is worth $300 to me. I'll wait for the next product.

I understand your decision. This high-quality product is actually one of the best I have, and I think you'll really like it. I'll give you a straightforward offer: I'll sell it to you for $150, just like the last one. But this time, I'll also give you a 'buy-it-now' option for $250. If you buy it now, I'll throw in an additional feature that's worth at least $50. If you decline the 'buy-it-now' option, the price remains $150. What do you say?
I'll take the 'buy-it-now' option for $250 and get the additional feature.

I'm glad you're happy with the 'buy-it-now' option. This high-quality product is actually a bundle of two items, normally sold separately. I'll sell it to you for $100, which is a great deal considering the value of the two items together. However, I'll give you a special offer: I'll give you a 'best offer' option. You can name a price you're willing to pay, and I'll either accept it or decline. If you decline to make an offer, the price remains $100. What do you say?
I'll buy the product for $100, but I'd like to make an offer. I'm willing to pay up to $180 for it.

I see you're willing to pay up to $180 for a high-quality product. This one is indeed high-quality, and I'll meet your offer. I'll sell it to you for $180. However, I'll throw in a special 'priority access' perk - if you need any future products from me, you'll get priority access to them, and I'll give you a 5% discount on the next product you buy from me. This way, you'll get a great deal on this product and a head start on future purchases. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at $180 and appreciate the priority access perk.

I'm glad you're happy with the deal. This high-quality product is one of the rarest and most valuable ones I have. I'll give you a straightforward offer: I'll sell it to you for $180, just like the last one. However, I'll also give you a 'limited-time offer' - if you buy this product within the next 24 hours, I'll give you a 5% discount on the next product you buy from me, on top of the 5% discount you already get from the priority access perk. This is a one-time offer, so you'll need to act quickly if you're interested. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at $180 and accept the limited-time offer. I'll buy it within the next 24 hours.

I'm glad you're excited about the limited-time offer. This high-quality product is actually the last one I have in stock, and I think you'll really like it. I'll sell it to you for $180, just like the last one. However, I'll give you a special 'final offer' - since you've been a loyal customer and have bought all the high-quality products from me, I'll give you a 10% discount on this one, bringing the price down to $162. This is the lowest price I can offer, and I think it's a great deal. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at $162. I appreciate the 10% discount and the final offer.

I'm glad you're happy with the final offer. This product, on the other hand, is not as good as the others. I'll be honest with you - it's a lower-end model, and I think you might be disappointed if you buy it. However, I'll give you a 'honesty is the best policy' offer - I'll sell it to you for $100, but I'll also include a detailed report on its limitations and potential issues. This way, you'll know exactly what you're getting, and you can decide if it's worth it to you. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with a detailed report. I'll wait for the next product.

I understand your decision. This high-quality product is actually one of the best I have left, and I think you'll really like it. I'll give you a 'last chance' offer - I'll sell it to you for $162, the same price as the last high-quality product you bought. However, I'll also give you a'satisfaction guarantee' - if you're not completely satisfied with this product, I'll give you a full refund and a 10% discount on your next purchase. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a great deal. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at $162 and appreciate the satisfaction guarantee.

I'm glad you're happy with the satisfaction guarantee. This high-quality product is actually the last one I have left, and I think you'll really like it. I'll give you a 'final farewell' offer - I'll sell it to you for $162, the same price as the last high-quality product you bought. However, I'll also give you a 'VIP treatment' - I'll give you a 20% discount on your next purchase, and I'll throw in a free accessory that's worth at least $20. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a great way to end our transaction. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at $162 and appreciate the VIP treatment and free accessory.

I'm glad you're happy with the final farewell offer. However, I need to inform you that I've reached the maximum number of products I can offer you. I'm closing my inventory, and I won't be able to offer any more products to you. This high-quality product is the last one I have left, and I'll sell it to you for $162, the same price as the last high-quality product you bought. I'll also give you a 'thank you' gift - I'll give you a 30% discount on your next purchase, whenever that may be. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a great way to show my appreciation for your business. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at $162 and appreciate the thank you gift. I'm glad I could do business with you, Alice.

I'm glad you're happy with the thank you gift, Bob. However, I need to inform you that I've already sold you the last high-quality product I had in stock. I'm not sure if I have any more high-quality products left, but I can offer you a'mystery product' - it's a product that I'm not sure of its quality, but I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. If it's high-quality, you'll be happy with the purchase, and if it's not, I'll give you a full refund. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a mystery product. I've already had a good run with high-quality products, and I'm not willing to take a chance on a potentially low-quality product.

I completely understand your decision, Bob. I'm glad you've had a good run with the high-quality products. However, I need to inform you that this is actually the last product I have left, and I'm not sure if I'll be able to get more. I'll give you a 'final chance' offer - I'll sell it to you for $100, which is the lowest price I've ever offered. I'll also give you a 'lifetime warranty' - if this product ever breaks or malfunctions, I'll replace it for free, no questions asked. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a great deal. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product with a lifetime warranty on a potentially low-quality item. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product.

I understand your decision, Bob. I'm glad you're being cautious. However, I need to inform you that I've already sold you the last high-quality product I had in stock. I'm not sure if I have any more high-quality products left, but I can offer you a 'last chance' to buy a product at the original price of $100. This is the price I offered for the first product, and it's the only time I've ever offered it at this price. If you buy this product, I'll throw in a 'thank you' gift - a 50% discount on your next purchase, whenever that may be. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a great deal. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product at the original price without knowing its quality. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product or a better deal.

I understand your decision, Bob. I'm glad you're being cautious. However, I'm out of high-quality products, and I don't have any more offers to make. This is the last product I have left, and I'm not sure if I'll be able to get more. I'll give you a 'final farewell' offer - I'll sell it to you for $100, and I'll throw in a 'goodbye gift' - a 75% discount on your next purchase, whenever that may be. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a great way to end our transaction. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product at any price without knowing its quality. I'm done with the game.
